---
title: "Download cleaned dataset"
---

## Overview

The cleaned case linelist is provided in RDS format and can be directly imported into R. The example code in each analysis task is already set up to work with this dataset, so you can simply download it and run the code without any modifications.

## Learning Objectives

- Download and import the cleaned example dataset
- Understand the dataset structure
- Use the dataset with the provided example code

## Download

The clean linelist is stored in RDS format and can be directly imported into R using `readRDS()`. This dataset is from the [Applied Epi R Handbook](https://www.epirhandbook.com/) and resembles a fictional Ebola outbreak.

<a href="data/linelist.rds" download class="btn btn-primary" target="_blank">Download clean linelist</a>

## Usage

After downloading, place the file in your `data/` folder and import it using:

```r
linelist <- readRDS("data/linelist.rds")
```

The example code in each analysis task is already set up to work with this dataset structure.
